alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 2:38PM EST until December 21 at 5:20AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Franklin, Oxford and Somerset and northern New Hampshire, including the following county, Coos. * WHEN...Until 700 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall and snowmelt. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 236 PM EST, Rain and snowmelt is occurring, and will cause flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Berlin, Fairfield, Lancaster, Bethlehem, Colebrook, Jackman, Eustis, Rangeley, Skowhegan and Pittsfield.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
